title: Loved it! Cool atmosphere.
text: Loved it! Cool atmosphere. Definitely worth the wait for a patio seat on a nice night. We were starving, so we chose a seat inside and enjoyed our dining experience. Server was friendly and attentive. Chicken pot pie, crispy Buffalo cauliflower, fish and chips all received great reviews from our table. Salmon was good, but needed more salt (and I’m not typically someone who uses table salt). Churros and chocolate waffle were amazing! We cannot wait to go back the next time we are in Tucson.

title: Skip the 7 Falls Hike
text: Beautiful park with lots of trails to hike, however, the hike to 7 Falls is not for the faint of heart. It’s blazing hot, so go early because it’s about 4 miles to the Falls and unless you’re bringing water with you, you’ll feel very dehydrated through this trek. Parts of the trail were not well marked and you could easily find yourself off route. Overall, I’d say if you’re going to do this hike, be well hydrated, wear shoes that are supportive but also shoes you’re not concerned about getting dirty or ruined, and APPLY SUNSCREEN.

title: Love this gem!
text: We make sure to plan at least one meal at La Indita whenever we visit Tucson. This place never fails. Casual and friendly place with delicious food and super friendly people.

title: Fresh and delicious.
text: Fresh and delicious. Great start to the day. I really enjoyed the morning bowl and clean it up juice. Both were so good! Avocado toast and breakfast sandwiches were also very good according to my family.
place: Goodness Fresh Food and Juice Bar

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We stayed at this hotel when in town for a sporting event. Clean room. Plenty of space. Nice shower and water pressure. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was grab and go due to COVID. Nothing fancy, but had breakfast food to get you through. Plenty of places around the area if you needed something different.

title: Great wings!
text: We called in an order for pizza and wings because pretty much every place was closing down due to bad weather. Cute place inside when I went in to pick up order. We got our take out went back to our rental and wow- we LOVED the wings. Totally wish we got more. The pizza was very good too. We’ll definitely hit Guiseppe’s up again!

title: Amazing place!
text: We have absolutely enjoyed our time here! Beautiful view of the lake and fire pits outside. Inside the of the cabin is beautifully decorated, inviting, and cozy. Shower is amazing. Such a wonderful start to the morning to wake up, make coffee & pancakes, and take in the scenery. Minutes from Wintergreen, restaurants, and breweries. Cannot wait to make this an annual tradition.

title: Great experience! Beautiful complex
text: Traveled to Pigeon Forge for The Big Orange Experience. This is a beautiful complex surrounded by the Smokey Mountains. Very well run and they did a great job of implementing protocols to keep people safe during COVID. Very impressed by this organization and quite possibly the only reason we’d ever return to the chaos of Pigeon Forge, would be to attend a tournament here again.

title: This place is SO GOOD!
text: We decided to get out of the Pigeon Forge craziness and headed to check out UT’s campus. Great little city. Enjoyed checking it out and we pulled up TripAdvisor to find a place for dinner. This restaurant is in a cute area with walkability to shops. Hostess was very friendly, as was our server. Food was delicious! Definitely get the house made fried pickle and the Mother Clucker sandwich. Amazing. Fries and onion rings also fantastic. Would love to go back if we find ourselves back in the area.

title: Enjoyed a family meal here
text: Enjoyed a family meal here and we were able to get in with minimal wait. Mac&cheese burger was good. Salmon salad was good. Black & Bleu salad had good flavor but steak tips were a little chewy. Ribeye was good, with good flavor. Server was friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend.

title: There are better choices for you money.
text: There are better choices for your money. We went as a family of 4. Very expensive for what you get. Definitely should have followed my rule of abstaining from ordering seafood in a land locked state, but it was our son’s choice, and we went along with it. I ordered one of the steam pots. Crab legs were good. Clams were teeny tiny. Mussels weren’t even edible. Sausage was subpar at best. Very expensive tab, for subpar food at best.

title: Delicious food and friendly service
text: We’ve visited several times during our stay. Great service and delicious food! We love their Moussaka. Pizza, souvlaki, and pasta options are also delicious. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Enjoyed stopping in for gelato
text: Enjoyed stopping in for gelato and a cannoli. Lots of flavors to choose from. Very friendly staff. Definitely worth stopping in.

title: Visit in Feb 2020
text: We stayed for two nights. Hotel is about 15 minutes from city center. Easy to get a cab there and back. Hotel staff were very friendly. Lobby and rooms were nice. Beds were comfortable. Room temperature was way too hot. We were provided with a fan, but this made a minimal difference and the room temperature interferes with sleep.

title: Beautiful! A Must-See!
text: We walked to see Trevi Fountain after taking two different tours the same day. We almost decided not to go because we were so tired, but we pressed on anyway. Thankful we did. The fountain was breathtakingly beautiful. Lots of shops and restaurants around there to recharge your energy.

title: Great place to stay
text: We stayed for two nights. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. We were treated to a plate of sweet treats in our room upon our arrival, which was very appreciated. Shower was delightful and bed was comfortable. Great shuttle service to visit the downtown market area. Would definitely recommend choosing this hotel!

title: Worth a look
text: Very nice museum with many artifacts. Very nice to walk through but I wish we had visited the museum first, then the Acropolis. You cannot take pictures in the museum.

title: A must-see if you are in Athens
text: This is definitely a must-see if you are in Athens. It is truly amazing to see the ancient architecture. Visiting during what is considered the off-season still drew quite a crowd, so I can only imagine how crowded it is in the summer. As the other reviews state, wear comfortable shoes because its quite a bit of walking/climbing and the terrain is uneven. The site is also very exposed to sunlight, so don’t forget a hat and/or sunscreen. Also, there are quite a few people outside of the park who will try to put bracelets on your arm for “free”. They are not free and it’s a really awkward situation. My advice is either say no and keep moving or plan on bringing a euro or two per bracelet (which are actually very cute).

title: Great lunch spot!
text: We stopped in for lunch during a day trip to Trapani. We opted to sit outside. Service was friendly. Food was excellent. We ordered several appetizers and small plates to share. The bruschetta was amazing, as were the Sicilian meatballs and the antipasto plate. Would definitely recommend this place.

title: Very good wood fired pizzas!
text: Very good wood fired pizzas! We enjoyed several different pizzas. My daughter and I split one pizza with onions, eggplant, sausage and mushrooms. Delicious! The guys all had their own pizzas and also enjoyed their orders. Nice, casual spot for a family meal.

title: Enjoyable dining experience!
text: Enjoyable dining experience! We chose the restaurant because it was within walking distance from the Marriott. We chose a table outside and the heat lamps made it perfect. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Food was delicious. We had the spinach pies, stuffed hamburger, chicken fillet, bread and Greek salad. Everything was so good. After our meal, we were brought fresh fruit and delicious little fried dough. We had a great evening out and I would definitely recommend this place.

title: Delicious!
text: Delicious! We stumbled in after visiting the Acropolis and Monastirski Flea Market. Absolutely delicious and staff were very friendly. We tried the pita bread, dolmades, sampler spreads (eggplant salad, spicy cheese, tziki). We also had the pork gyro. Definitely recommend this place. English menus available. WiFi available.

title: Beautiful church
text: Beautiful church set in a beautiful town. Lots of history and across from the Airborne Museum. Parachute still hangs near the top of the church to commemorate D-Day

title: Great walk through history
text: Amazing place to visit. The walk is breathtaking and there are many placards along the way to read. Wear comfortable walking shoes. Bunkers still there that you can walk through.

title: Sacred ground
text: Amazing experience visiting this sacred ground. It’s humbling, to say the very least, to look around and see the memorialized sacrifices of the greatest generation. We left with a deep sense of appreciation and gratitude.

title: Nice museum
text: This was a very nice museum and staff were very friendly. Learned a lot about the French Resistance efforts during WWII. Films in French and English.

title: Emotionally moving experience
text: We thoroughly enjoyed this emotionally moving experience. It brought me to tears. The cinema is located on a beautiful point overlooking the town. Beautiful sculptures near the entrance. Nice gift shop. Friendly staff.

title: Delightful stay
text: We stayed for one night as we toured France. All of us agreed that our stay here was the most delightful stay we had in all of France. This B&B was delightful. Beds were amazingly comfortable. Each room had a private bathroom. The breakfast was so delicious! Our hostess was very gracious and provided us with some history about the area. If possible, we one day hope to return. We highly recommended staying here if you are visiting this area.

title: Perfect place for an afternoon snack
text: We really enjoyed our visit here. Perfect place for an afternoon snack. Cheese samples available. Snack on cheese, sausage, bread, and grab a beer. Friendly counter service.

title: Delicious and great service!
text: Ended up here after hotel staff recommended this place. Burgers were delicious! Cool atmosphere in restaurant. Staff were extremely friendly and nice to converse with.

title: Nice stay
text: We stopped in after a long car ride and the manager was able to provide us with two rooms. She was very friendly and accommodating. She provided us with recommendations for a nice meal. Rooms were very clean. Shower felt amazing. Tea and coffee in rooms. Nice breakfast in the morning. Free WiFi. Not a bad drive to Munich airport. We highly recommend staying here if you are visiting Augsburg.

title: Beautiful church
text: Attended Christmas Eve mass. Absolutely beautiful church service. Even though the service was in French and we couldn’t understand much of what was being said, the experience was unforgettable.

title: Great location
text: Great location for our first ever visit to Paris. Hotel is undergoing renovations but still lovely. View of the Eiffel Tower from the room was a beautiful plus. We walked to the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Musée D’Orsay, and Champs Elysee from the hotel. Rooms were adequate size. No coffee in room but breakfast buffet was delicious. Bring adapters for outlets, as the hotel does not provide any. You can purchase adapters across the street at the Monoprix for about 10 Euros. Elavators are small but who cares. That did not impact our stay. Some staff were friendly, others weren’t overtly rude, but not super welcoming. But, you’d find that in any city worldwide, so we brushed it off. Overall, we had a pleasant stay.

title: Enjoyable experience
text: Enjoyed our time at the museum. Line was not too long to enter. If you are traveling with a student, make sure they bring their student ID so the get free admission to this museum. Beautiful place inside and not too crowded on the day we were there. Free WiFi. Two cafes on premise. Museum staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Cool experience
text: The only reason I’m giving this 4 stars is because it’s the Eiffel Tower and it’s something you should experience if you are in Paris. We waited forever in line to purchase tickets to go up. When we got up to one of the two ticket windows open, the lady closed that window without explanation and we were left standing there wondering if we should wait or try to merge into the other ticket window line. We ended up merging over but there was zero direction from any staff. When we were finally at the window, my husband asked the woman behind the counter a question about purchasing tickets for the following day so that our daughter could go all the way up to the top. She would only answer with a dismissive “maybe”. Once up at the observation deck, it’s a beautiful view of the city, but extremely crowded. You can easily become separated from your group so it’s best to set a time to meet up at the bottom, just in case. Overall, I would expect better crowd management. I would also recommend buying tickets online to avoid waiting for at least an hour to buy the same day ticket.

title: Nice cafe
text: We stumbled upon this cafe while walking around Paris. Our experience was a pleasant one. Enjoyed cafe creme and croque madame. Our server was nice and WiFi was available.

title: So good! Definitely order
text: So good! Definitely order the pretzel soup. All of us agreed that soup is crazy good. Schnitzel was good. Friendly staff and cool, casual atmosphere.

title: The atmosphere here is stunning.
text: The atmosphere here is stunning. I thoroughly enjoyed dinner because of the dimly lit and beautifully decorated room. The food was good. Enjoyed the schnitzel and spaetzle. Desserts were a work of art.

title: Amazing views
text: The views were amazing! Couldn’t have been a better day for our visit. The train ride up is about an hour but it’s a beautiful ride.

title: Great place
text: Enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms were clean. Beds were comfortable. My only suggestion would be to add phone charging stations in the rooms. Staff were nice and helpful. Enjoyed the Market each morning for coffee.

title: This place is a gem!
text: This place is a gem! Enjoyed the beer and food. Dinner was cafeteria style, which was awesome because you were able to see everything and make selections. Staff were very friendly. This was probably one of our favorite places during our visit. Great atmosphere on the inside and in the courtyard.

title: Beautiful!
text: Simply beautiful! The architecture was so amazing. Definitely recommend this for people with older kids who can appreciate the experience.

title: Tasty spot in fun, casual atmosphere
text: Tried Billy Jack’s for the first time. We loved it. Reminded me of a cool beach-type spot. Definitely try the sliders. You can pick two sliders and a side. Good portions. Good beer list. The Buford T. Justice is quite possibly one of the best sandwiches around. It seriously rendered my husband speechless, with the exception of a few moans. Can’t wait to come back and try brunch.

title: Good location
text: Good location. Can walk to restaurants. Front desk staff very nice. Carpet in hallways needed vacuuming. Food was left in our fridge from previous occupant. Pillows were about as fluffy as an thin envelope. Bathrooms need some attending. Housekeeping staff knocked on our door at 9:30 am. Check out was at 11. Parking onsite. Nice to have a pool onsite.

title: Great BBQ
text: Visited while in town. Nice spot. Friendly staff. Food was amazing. Pulled pork excellent. Nashville Hot Catfish was amazing. Cheese grits delicious. Potato salad and Mac & Cheese could use a bit more salt (this is coming from someone who never salts food). Would definitely recommend this place.

title: Nice place
text: First time staying here. Very nice rooms with a good amount of space for a family of 4 with teenagers. Nice amenities onsite, including different pools, workout facilities, grills, resting, bars, and a market. Would definitely stay here again.
place: Sheraton Vistana Villages Resort Villas, I-Drive/Orlando

title: Enjoyed our time
text: We were looking forward to visiting Bubba Gump because our kids had never been to one. Don’t let the wait fool you, it went by rather quickly and was on par with the wait time we were given by the host. Waiter was great. Very energetic and polite. Food was good and served timely. Enjoyed our time here. Only recommendation would be a little more attention to the restrooms. It’s a very busy restaurant, so I get it, but women’s room was in a bit of disarray.

title: Great roller coasters
text: First time at Sea World. We enjoyed our time. Roller coasters were fantastic. Park employees were friendly. Smaller park feel when you’re comparing to other parks in Orlando. Only negative feedback I would give is we found it disappointing that there were no employees monitoring the long ride lines. People were frequently jumping the long lines without regard for others. Frustrating.

title: Great place
text: First time eating here. Loved the jalapeño cornbread. Cobb salad was very good. Decent beer list. Our server, Jake, provided great service. Live acoustic music inside. Really enjoyed it. Would definitely recommend stopping in.

title: Lots of shopping
text: Love this place. It’s pretty and clean. Lots of shopping, sort of like an upscale outdoor mall. Lots of restaurant options too

title: Lots of options
text: Cool place to visit at night because of all the lights. Lots of options for meals at different price ranges. Lots of parking but I’d recommend going at night to get free parking. Definitely a busy place, so if crowds aren’t your thing, it may be a little overwhelming.

title: Great place to stay off 95
text: Location is key. Right off 95. Stayed one night on the way down to FL. Very clean hotel. We arrived around midnight. Night staff was very friendly at check in. Comfy beds. Good water pressure in shower. Very nice continental breakfast included in morning. Kids love that breakfast included option of smoothies. If you have a choice, stay here for sure!

title: Good family meal spot
text: Stopped in on the way home from a long road trip. Nice, casual spot for dinner. Large menu with lots of good sandwiches. Good house-made chips. Delicious cakes for dessert. Good beer list.

title: Best Rooftop Bar in RVA
text: Had a fabulous ladies night out! Beautiful setting. Great drink options and good food. Staff were extremely friendly. Good mix of people and good vibes there.

title: Wow!
text: Delicious! Cute little ice cream shop. Friendly staff. I definitely recommend the Brown Sugar Cookie Dough ice cream!

title: Fresh, beautiful food
text: We ate here because we were trying to go to Strawberry Street Cafe and quickly realized the change in restaurants. They’ve renovated the inside. It’s beautiful, clean, with a modern edge. Hostess was very nice. My biggest issue was the lack of description about the dishes on the menu. Food was FRESH and artsy. Beautiful plate presentation. We had the babaganoush and kimchi rice. Both were delicious! Husband order a beef dish. Flavor was fantastic but meat was a little tough. Wine was good. Our son ordered pasta from the kids menu. If your child doesn’t have a sophisticated palate, they will likely leave hungry. Personally, I enjoyed his buttered, fresh fettuccine noodles, but he did not. I would definitely suggest this place for a date night. Cool, calm vibes.

title: Delicious
text: We enjoyed our dinner at Cafe Provençal. The charcuterie board is a must. The pairings were delightful. Our server said the charcuterie board is ever-changing. I can definitely recommend the filet. Cooked perfectly. The pork tenderloin was a bit disappointing due to the size. Flavor was fantastic, but it was about the size of a medium-sized rib, with very few sides to make up for it. Dessert was delicious. Our server was great. We definitely look forward to going back.

title: Loved this place!
text: Had dinner with my daughter and absolutely loved this place. It was so nice to sit in the restaurant with the open-air windows. Restaurant was beautifully decorated and menu had so many fun options. We both opted for Cobb salad with blackened chicken. Quite possibly one of the best Cobb salads I’ve ever eaten. We shared the Krispy Kreme bread pudding for dessert. Fun, cool vibe. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Good Family Spot
text: This place is a lovely spot for a family meal. Staff were very attentive and super friendly. Shoe-string fries were delicious! We were not impressed by the Nashville fried chicken. It was hot, but flavorless. The fried pickles were tasty, but for the life of me, I will never understand why a restaurant chooses pickle spears over pickle chips. Overall, we are excited to go back and try burgers and wings another night.

title: Crazy good
text: Visited Whisk with my daughter who loves French macaroons. I love lattes. This place had the best latte I’ve ever tasted. The chocolate macaroon was amazing, as was the ham and cheese croissant. Can’t wait to go back! Such a quaint place with nice staff and crazy good treats.

title: Fun place but very crowded
text: This is truly the Chuck E. Cheese for adults- right down to the small plastic cups to hold your tokens. You need to start by getting a card that you link to your credit/debit card. That card you keep on you for the night and use at their self-serve taps. You just bring the card to the counter at the end of your night and they give you the tab. Pretty simple. Lots of games to play, including fun blasts from the past. The only drawback is that it’s pretty crowded. Otherwise, it’s a fun place to check out with friends

title: Cool place
text: My child’s sports team participated in a 3-day tournament at ESPN. The atmosphere here is very cool. They do a good job with field maintenance and the grounds are clean. My only complaint is they do a good job of getting as much money out of you as possible. If you get an adult beverage, you pay extra for the cup, then a reduced price after that if you’d like another drink. The next day, they change the cup color, so you have to buy the cup again each day. They bring in food trucks, with great food, but be cautious because some of the food trucks are very overpriced. Overall, this was a very good experience with a fun, upbeat atmosphere

title: Great place to stay
text: This was our first time staying here and we enjoyed it. It was easy to set up transportation to the hotel from the airport via the Magic Express. Rooms were clean. Hotel had some construction going on. Good variety of restaurants. If we go back, we will definitely get the meal plan. Nice gym onsite. Hotel staff were very friendly. Plenty of washer & dryers in laundry room if you are traveling there with a sports team. Good transportation to ESPN, Magic Kingdom, Disney Springs, etc.

title: Ok but expensive
text: We traveled with a group and decided it would be fun to eat here on the first night of our trip. The atmosphere is pretty cool, but if you’ve been to one Planet Hollywood, you’ve kinda been to them all. I had the steak salad. It was good, but pretty typical and expensive. Be weary of the upselling for a souvenir glass. Service was ok. Our server seemed to have an attitude when we weren’t all buying overpriced alcohol in cheesy souvenir glasses, instead requesting water. I put that more on his maturity level than the restaurant though.

title: Bathrooms were dirty, customer service down
text: I’m a big lover of Disney and the Magic Kingdom. The Magic Kingdom is still, I believe, one of the greatest places to bring children. I was a bit disappointed this visit though. The bathrooms were so dirty this visit. I understand the high volume of visitors, but we’ve visited during peak times of the year, and the bathrooms were much cleaner then. I witnessed one staff member in the bathroom on her phone and not attending to the needed bathroom care. This really surprised me. I was also taken back by the dismissive attitude of the workers at one of the food vendors. I’ve never seen Disney through this lens before- made it feel like an average theme park visit rather than the magical place I’ve visited in the past

title: Relaxing place for apps and cocktails!
text: Really enjoyed this place. We were in town for a sports event. Great place for apps and cocktails. Nice to sit on the water. Popcorn chicken, empanadas, were both really good.

title: Centrally located
text: Very nice hotel, but under a lot of renovation during our visit. Staff were very friendly and rooms were already beautifully updated. Renovations are occurring in lobby. Comfy beds, nice lounge area for a cocktail, and this hotel is so centrally located if you are here to see sights, catch a show, etc.

title: Loved it!
text: Our family of 4 enjoyed seeing A Christmas Carol at Ford’s Theater. This was probably on of the best renditions of the story I’ve ever seen. Very well done. The theater is beautiful and you can tour a history of the museum before the show. We are excited to make this an annual tradition!

title: Lovely evening
text: We came in town for one night to see a show at Ford’s Theater. We stayed at the JW Marriott and chose Old Ebbitt Grill so that we could park the car at check in to the hotel and not move it again until we checked out. We really enjoyed our dinner. I would definitely recommend making reservations. Our server was attentive and friendly. The food was delicious. I had the scallops and my husband had a pasta dish. Kids enjoyed items on the kids menu. We our cheese plate and desserts. Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Loved it!
text: Loved this place. First time I’d visited. Went with a group of couples. Food was delicious. I had salmon and it was perfectly cooked. Husband had the fish special and raves about it. Can’t wait to go back and try other entrees, as every entree ordered by people at the table looked fantastic. Our server, Taylor, was very attentive and friendly. Can’t wait to bring out of town family back there. Also, loved the decor. Fresh, clean, classy. Can’t say enough good stuff about this place.

title: Go and have a good time!
text: Went with a group of girlfriends to celebrate birthdays. First time I had been there and loved it. Very friendly and fun staff. Performers were witty and hilarious. Food was delicious.

title: Not overly impressed
text: We’ve driven by many times and have always seen this placed packed. We’ve also heard good things about this place. We decided to head over after watching a baseball game at the Diamond. Perhaps it’s because we were seated outside, but our waiter just continued to forget about us. I mean, gone, and this happened more than once. He was very nice and always apologetic when he’d come back to our table. However, after waiting for over 20 minutes for him to return with our credit card after giving it to him for the bill, we had finally reached our limit. As crowded as we’ve seen this restaurant, it was not nearly as busy as those nights, so I have to lean towards poor time management on the part of the server. Food was average. The consensus of the table was we had all had better burgers in RVA. Milkshakes were very good, not too thick and not too thin. All in all, we aren’t hard pressed to go back.

title: Beautiful view!
text: We really enjoyed our time at Kabana! Gorgeous view of the city with a swanky lounge feel. Good service and very cold drinks, which was perfect on a hot day. Food is only reason I’m not giving it 5 Stars. Brussel sprouts were amazing. Tacos were average at best. Wings were good.

title: Great little spot to stop in!
text: Love this place. Very friendly staff. Good place for casual family dinner. Music on Friday nights. Big menu and food is very good. We’ve loved the fried catfish, hush puppies, Cajun chicken wrap, steak and cheese wrap, list goes on and on. Nothing fancy, but good cooking and good people. Get the lemonade- it’s fresh and SO good!

title: Nice hotel
text: This is a very nice hotel, centrally located. Very clean. Check in was a bit congested. I would suggest you check your reservation carefully. I called to book our room and did not book online. I specifically asked for 2 beds, as we were traveling as a family of 4. When we got to the room, there was one double bed. I called guest services and spoke with a woman who was rude and simply stated all rooms with double beds were booked for the night. I asked for a cot, she said she didn’t have any. She offered NO solutions and was very unapologetic, stating that was the room I booked. I insisted I would never book one queen bed for a family of 4. The conversation was over on her end. I called back and requested extra blankets and pillows. I continued to call throughout the day, leaving two messages for management. I received a call back from a woman who was very nice and offered a king room with a pullout. By the time we got back to the hotel after the baseball game, we spoke with Alex at the front desk and he stated a room with 2 double beds had become available. He was very accommodating and we appreciate his assistance. Also great was Gary, valet/front door. He was very welcoming and gave us great info about the city. Rooms are clean and beds were comfortable. There’s a restaurant and bar onsite. Tons of families and a good hotel if you are traveling with kids. Not far from subway. Overall, we would definitely stay here again but I will make sure to double check the reservation, as my email confirmation was very vague.
place: Sheraton New York Times Square Hotel

title: Overrated
text: Very busy and full of junky tourist trap stores. Checked off bucket list. Spend all of 5 minutes there and you’ll be wondering why you didn’t opt for the beach vacation

title: Cool slice of NYC
text: This was probably one of the bright spots on our trip. Cool area where you can find just about any type of food you want to eat. Plenty of tables to sit, eat, and people watch.

title: Nice ballpark
text: We enjoyed visiting Yankee Stadium and watching a game. Easy to get to by subway. Very friendly staff who were very helpful. You can tell their employees take a lot of pride in their jobs. Stadium was very clean. I was expecting prices to be much higher than they were. Prices seem pretty similar to other smaller market stadiums we’ve visited. We really enjoyed the game and this park!
